articles/gettingstarted/components/app.h.title: APP | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/components/app.h.summary: SupplyChain365 APP component TABLE OF CONTENTS Login Warehouse functions Transport functions Defects User and group management Permission sets Resources Time registrations Schedule activities Version management Login You can log in with an AzureAD user. In this way, a user can login via the latest security options and this simplifies management. MFA can also be enabled. Warehouse functions Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform warehouse activities. Transport functions Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform transport activities. Defects Register workplace defects in every logistics process with the SupplyChain365 APP. Add photos and descriptions for further handling in the back office. User and group management Group warehouse or transport employees. For warehouse groups it is possible to assign activities to a group. (e.g. group of reach truckers for storage tasks and clearing) Permission sets It is possible to assign preference sets to user groups. With the help of these permission sets it is possible to block functionality for certain users. Resources Assign warehouse and transport workers to resources so that resource planning and costs become transparent for all transport and warehouse activities. Time registrations Record time registrations per warehouse employee, warehouse activity and document. For transport the consignments and trip activities are recorded. Schedule activities It is possible to schedule specific orders for a certain time so that they do not become visible to the employee or specifically to a certain employee or group in the mobile application before a certain date or time. Version management It is possible to view the actual version of the mobile app. Besides that the app checks if all the necessary versions are available that are in use. If the backend required a new version of the app there will be a message shown.

articles/gettingstarted/components/exten.title: SupplyChain365 Extension component | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/components/exten.summary:
SupplyChain365 Extension component | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 Extension component TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Extension Extension setup data Extension demo data Role center Link Business Central to portal License plates (nested) Warehouse agent Session list Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Extension With the help of the SupplyChain365 extension, Business Central can be expanded with additional functionalities. Extension setup data The SupplyChain365 extension provides a function with which setup data (no transaction data) can be loaded so that the system is immediately ready for use. Extension demo data The SupplyChain365 extension provides a function with which a set of SkyNet demo data can be automatically loaded to start direct WMS and TMS demonstration transactions. Role center The Supplychain365 extension provides a specific role in Business Central to have an overview of all the most important processes. Link Business Central to portal To use the Supplychain365 extension correctly, it is important to link Business Central to the portal. This can be done through this functionality. License plates (nested) It is possible to use nested license plates. So it is possible to easily add and remove combined goods to a pallet with a new license plate coupled. Warehouse agent With the warehouse agent it is possible to block document or document line. When one employee is active in the app with the document no other user can open that document or document line. Session list In the extension there is a view to show all active app sessions in the environment.

articles/gettingstarted/components/porta.title: SupplyChain365 Portal component | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/components/porta.summary:
SupplyChain365 Portal component | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 Portal component TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Portal License management User management Environment management Manage mobile Android devices Manage label printers Manage label layouts Manage access for partners (collaborate & exchange) License and services consumption Invoices & payments Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Portal In the Supplychain365 portal, administrative matters can be carried out by a user with administrative rights. It provides insight into consumption and active licenses. It is also possible to manage licenses, users, mobile devices, printers, label layouts and access for external partners. License management Manage SupplyChain365 licenses. Increase or decrease the number of licenses actually needed for mobile users and modules in the SupplyChain365 admin portal on a daily basis. User management Manage SupplyChain365 portal users for management tasks (Admin) and common tasks (Users). Environment management Manage Business Central environments (Production & Sandboxes) and the connection to SupplyChain365. Manage mobile Android devices Add mobile devices and connect them to SupplyChain365 for warehouse workers and drivers. Manage label printers Add label printers that are used in the organization to use in the logistics process. Manage label layouts Manage and edit printing label layouts from License Plate labels to serial number lists. Manage access for partners (collaborate & exchange) Add External Users to SupplyChain365 Chain partners (customers and suppliers) and give them access to your partner portal to collaborate digitally. License and services consumption View the consumption of SupplyChain365 licenses and API services at any time and view monthly overviews. Invoices & payments Insight into the invoices and payments of the current (estimate) and months in the past from the consumption of modules and licenses.

articles/gettingstarted/generalinformati.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Demo Company Skynet | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/generalinformati.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Demo Company Skynet | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Demo Company Skynet To properly and quickly experience the functionalities of SupplyChain365, a demo company Skynet has been set up. In a sandbox environment it is easily possible to load the demo data associated with this customer case. TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction to Skynet SkyNet is a company that specializes in Drones. They assemble drones and sell ready-made drones that they purchase from their suppliers. In addition, they have all kinds of drone-related items in their range that they produce, assemble, purchase and sell themselves. SkyNet sells as many products as possible from stock to end customers and stores. They are known for keeping a neat stock administration because they check their stock very regularly with counts and make corrections if necessary. Because new products are introduced very quickly in the world of drones, it is crucial for SkyNet that they are never left with outdated products that customers no longer want to buy. After all, drones are very expensive. SkyNet has its own fleet of trucks with which they can pick up products from suppliers and deliver them to customers. Possibly with a temporary storage in one of the warehouses. SkyNet also does warehousing and logistics for third parties (3PL-third party logistics), these are webshop and traders who do not have a warehouse and / or transport themselves. SkyNet wants to introduce a new system to support their supply chain execution Supply chain execution refers to the process of controlling the flow of goods within the supply chain â€“ from procurement to the delivery of the last mile. Activities included in the execution of the supply chain are production, distribution, storage, fulfillment and transport. Skynet team SkyNet has assembled a team of employees responsible for implementing a new IT system for the entire supply chain execution of SkyNet. +upyT+I+Zm6/8CP8qhm+4v8AvUUVYiufvfh/WpF6n60UVoU/hFbofpUUf3h9aKKxkSSv9w/Sq6/6 0fSiiiO5UdizRRRVdUSUNQ+4frVWx/1g+tFFYPc3X8MuN0P0qo3U/WiikQf/2Q== ) Karel is precise and requires his organization to keep a very accurate stock and have optimal logistical execution. He strives for 100% error-free logistics. It was his idea to make SkyNet a logistics service provider in addition to being a wholesaler. That move turns out to be genius for SkyNet in terms of inventory and revenue speed. Karel therefore finds it very important to have a complete overview of his logistics process from warehouse to transport. Karel likes automated reports, dashboards and KPIs of the SCOR model. Karel wants to be informed by his warehouse and transport manager when bottlenecks arise in the supply chain. Karel wants to automate and optimize as much as possible. He likes standards such as EDI GS1 and OTM (https://www.sutc.nl/) to work digitally with chain partners. Vanessa uses storage strategy based on data to be able to deliver orders 100% correctly to customers as soon as possible. goods arrive and are stored in the warehouse. According to Christina, things can always be better and faster in the warehouse. Her goal is to store incoming products in the warehouse in a smart way so that they can be knocked out as quickly as possible, with as little effort as possible. She hates having to enter information twice and wants the applications she and her team have to work with to be easy to use. Every click is one too many for her. A1fMrHNye87F2dhnFVZTjoRVZ7+YH14pv212IBT8c0uYpRaHTEgVFkeop0khIJIqKpLR/9k= ) Jim mainly works on the results side of the warehouse process. They mainly do picking, packing and shipping. With his team, he aims to have all orders at the right time slot at the right shipping dock for shipment to the customer. Jim knows that zone picking and batch picking have major advantages for the speed with which orders can be collected. In his previous work, Jim has gained experience with how items from different zones of one order can be consolidated at a packing bin using bin code on a traffic cone. 9VJHpP7b/wC0DL8SPGlr4G8N6gf7M8PxiOWSFsLPd7cSMPZeVH40V4MAAc460V6N2tD4Nycnc//Z ) Peter is of the old school, he prefers not to work with computers on his truck, only if he really has to. But then it should also be super easy to use. If he has to work with an App, integrated navigation is very important and he wants to be able to call contacts of the company to which he is on his way at all times. He hates paper administration and it often happens that Peter forgets to fill out his papers on deliveries. He also often goes wrong with time registration and when he has to make deliveries that include cash on delivery payments. An App should really help him with that. Skynet items SkyNet has several articles. Large and small items, articles in different variants (colours/sizes/designs) and packaging quantities (box/roll container/pallet/piece) a unit of measurement (numbers/length/width/height/volume/weight). Items can have different reference numbers with customers and suppliers and different identification carriers (barcodes). SkyNet items may have serial numbers for warranty and customer registration purposes. SkyNet also has items that contain lot numbers because these items are from a certain delivery or production batch. Often these items also contain an expiration date. Also, SkyNet has Serial Lot number items. These are items that contain a certain delivery/production batch number and a unique serial number for each product of that batch (lot). SkyNet wants to be able to easily scan and label barcodes and RFID serial and lot numbers. It is important for SkyNet that items that have been in the warehouse a little longer are shipped first to prevent products from aging. SkyNet always wants to work FiFo (First-in First out) or FeFo (First Expired First out). SkyNet has commodities (purchasing/selling), assembly items (assembling, bill of materials, bom, bill-of-material) and production items (consumption raw materials yield product or semi-finished product). It is important for SkyNet to have a simple registration of which serial/lot number items are used for assembly and/or production. SkyNet wants to use an ABC classification for items and thus have an alignment with the warehouse layout and allocation of picking locations. SkyNet wants a regular analysis of this ABC classification based on archived sales order and/or pick orders and/or volume, quantity, kilogram, etc. and get a recommendation for ABC classification by items or warehouse storage location (bins). Be able to automatically adopt or manually modify this recommendation. Warehouse execution SkyNet has a number of warehouses spread over multiple locations where there is stock to deliver products to the customer as quickly as possible from a local warehouse. SkyNet's warehouses have rack zones and bins. Bins have a unique storage number (bin code). We keep track of which stock is at which storage locations and for how long. At warehouse locations Hardbox and Normbox no controlled storage and removal is used. Corebox does use controlled storage and rash. (directed put-away & pick). The system can then take into account the volume and weight of the items and the capacity volume and weight of the storage location. This allows SkyNet to work with storage location type (BinTypes) and Zones. In SkyNet's warehouses, items are placed as much as possible on pallets, containers, bins and boxes (handling units) in the warehouse racks after receipt. In the reception process, SkyNet wants to provide these handling units with a license plate barcode (if there is not one yet) for fast handling of further logistics activities in the warehouse process. As a result, for example, they only have to enter serial or lot numbers once of items that are on a pallet during a storage action by scanning this license plate. For deliveries of, for example, pallets that are already provided with Licenseplates and/or SSCC codes at the time of pre-registration, no serial or lot numbers data needs to be entered at all because it is already digitally present in the system at the warehouse reception. SkyNet bulk wants to put items away in the warehouse and create replenishment orders to provide items with the right amount of stock at pick locations. It is therefore possible that at a certain time of the day stock movement tasks must be automatically made of items that are at a bulk storage location on, for example, a pallet or handling unit with a license plate code that must be moved to a pick location in the warehouse. It is also possible that goods have to be moved between warehouses with transfer orders. SkyNet wants transfer orders to be automatically created based on order planning to have the right stock in the right warehouse as quickly as possible for shipment to the customer. The transport orders for SkyNet can come from a number of different sources. It may be that SkyNet has indicated on a sales order or purchase order that it must be delivered to the customer with its own transport. It is possible that SkyNet 3PL receives result orders (orders from customers of SkyNet's 3PL customers) that have to be delivered with their own transport. 3PL Customer Because of their expertise in drone logistics, there are a number of webshop customers (3PL customers) who use SkyNet's logistics organization to have their own products delivered by SkyNet to their customers (3PL fulfillment). SkyNet therefore does stock management and deliveries for third parties. This stock is therefore not from SkyNet but from the relevant 3PL customer. SkyNet charges these customers a custody fee for the use of warehouse locations and rates for handling logistics activities (goods receipt, storage, picking, shipping, transport, delivery, collection, cash on delivery payments, etc.). SkyNet wants to pass on all warehouse and transport activities to 3PL customers based on activity, numbers, weight, volume, distance (kilometers) and time (time registration). SkyNet wants to be able to give 3PL customers a volume discount for the invoicing of these matters.some tekst

articles/gettingstarted/generalinformati.title: SupplyChain365 General information | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/generalinformati.summary: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) supply chain execution software for medium-sized organizations that can be started immediately. Available directly from the Microsoft Azure cloud and 100% integrated with Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central. Start quickly and easily with Warehouse Execution and/or Transport Execution functions and use the advantages of this modern platform in a short time. The system is easy to use but offers sufficient options for supporting more advanced processes for both Warehouse and Transport Operations in combination with the powerplatform and a modern Microsoft365 workspace. SupplyChain365 consists of 4 modules and a number of components: the Business Central Extension, a portal for management, an App that can be downloaded from the Playstore and the SupplyChain365 API so the system can digitally collaborate with supply chain partners and other systems. articles/gettingstarted/generalinformati.summary: SupplyChain365 General information SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) supply chain execution software for medium-sized organizations that can be started immediately. Available directly from the Microsoft Azure cloud and 100% integrated with Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central. Start quickly and easily with Warehouse Execution and/or Transport Execution functions and use the advantages of this modern platform in a short time. The system is easy to use but offers sufficient options for supporting more advanced processes for both Warehouse and Transport Operations in combination with the powerplatform and a modern Microsoft365 workspace. SupplyChain365 consists of 4 modules and a number of components: the Business Central Extension, a portal for management, an App that can be downloaded from the Playstore and the SupplyChain365 API so the system can digitally collaborate with supply chain partners and other systems. SupplyChain365 User license agreement User agreement SaaS with regard to SupplyChain365 between OPAL Associates BV as Contractor and SupplyChain365 Tenant user as User Parties OPAL Associates BV, having as its address Kerkenbos 1019, 6546 BB Nijmegen, with KvK number 09154054, duly represented for this purpose by Stephan Smink. (the Contractor) SupplyChain365 Tenant Administrator, duly represented for this purpose by the User OPAL Associates BV and User each being a Party and together Parties. Background Contractor has developed and exclusively owns the software SupplyChain365 which makes SupplyChain365 an extension (expansion) for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service supply chain execution solution and adds Warehouse management and Transport management functionalities to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The system provides internet web-based technology and mobile applications which are available via Cloud computing. SupplyChain365 increases inventory visibility in the supply chain and enables supply chain partners to collaborate digitally. (The Software). Contractor provides the Software via Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). This means that Contractor offers User access to the Software via the Internet. User wishes to use the Software via SaaS. Contractor wishes to offer User this possibility, under the conditions set out in this agreement (the Agreement). Contractor also works with partners (the Partner) to deliver the Software to Users. A Partner is, for example, a Microsoft Cloud Solutions Provider or Microsoft Solution Partner or Microsoft Dynamics partner. Definitions OPAL BV: Is the creator, developer, owner and supplier of the SupplyChain365 Software. The Software: SupplyChain365 is the SaaS software solution supplied by OPAL BV to end customers and users. Possibly with the help of Partner. SaaS: Software as a Service provides access to software applications via the internet, on a subscription basis. Tenant: Tenant is a hirer or subscriber of the SaaS solution. This is often a company, institution or group. User: A User is a person with an identity with the Tenant who uses the SaaS solution. Microsoft: Microsoft develops, distributes, licences and supports a wide range of computer-related products and services. The SaaS software SupplyChain365 is based on Microsoft products and services and extends the functionality of Microsoft Business Central. Partner: Partner is a Microsoft ICT partner that provides products and services from Microsoft. Specifically, partner is a provider of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central solutions and services. Agreement Permission to use the Software Contractor authorises User to use the Software. Whereby the Contractor remains the owner of the Software. User may not copy the Software. This permission is non-exclusive and non-transferable. User may only use the Software for automating and digitising logistics and supply chain execution processes for its organisation. User needs Contractor's prior consent if it wishes to use the Software for any other purpose. User must register on Contractor's registration website with a valid Microsoft for work or school account. The registration is validated on the validity of an EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft Tenant ID and a valid payment method. After Contractor has approved the registration, User will receive access to the SupplyChain365 portal and an email with further instructions to start using the Software. Registration for the Software can only be carried out by a Tenant Administrator. This is a User of the organisation authorised to enter into such Agreements. By agreeing, completing the registration, the User declares that he agrees with the NLdigital general terms and conditions and User Agreement SaaS of OPAL Associates BV and thereby digitally signs this Agreement. User may import any Office365/Microsoft365 user accounts within the Microsoft tenant. These Users become sub-Users of the Software. User is responsible for the use of the Software by the sub-Users. On the SupplyChain365 portal, Tenant Administrators can add their Office365 users and specify whether or not these Users are given administrator rights within the SupplyChain365 portal and whether they can log in to the SupplyChain365 portal. The portal gives Users access to general functions such as linking devices and printers etc. The portal gives administrators access to functions such as setting access rights for Users, viewing invoices and licence management etc. General terms and conditions The NLdigital general terms and conditions (the General Terms and Conditions) form part of this Agreement. User is aware of the contents and has been able to read and download a copy of the Terms and Conditions from https://www.opalbv.com/algemene-voorwaarden/ prior to agreement. These terms and conditions are available in 4 languages: Dutch, English, German and French. Prices and payment For the use of the Software, User shall pay the charges as specified in the licence section of the SupplyChain365 portal. The User can change the number of licences himself at any time. Every 24 hours, the number of licences used is determined and charged on the monthly invoice. The Licences are delivered in the form of a subscription according to a pay-as-you-go model. The quoted cost of the licences does not include VAT. Current licence prices can be found on the SupplyChain365 portal. Contractor shall collect the said charges monthly. Contractor may change the prices referred to in paragraph 1 at any time. Price changes shall be notified by email to the Tenant's administrator contact person at least 1 month in advance. Duration, renewal and end of Agreement The parties enter into this Agreement for an indefinite period of time. A user with Administrator rights may terminate the subscription and therefore this Agreement at any time, whereby the rights and ownership of the Software remain with Contractor. The Software is available to User free of charge for a trial period (Trail period) of 10 days. All functionality and licences will be available during the trial period, but User cannot add additional licences. User can end the trial period and purchase licences to start working with the system. If the trial period ends and no licences are purchased, the User is in a grace period. This grace period lasts a maximum of 10 days. If the User does not purchase any licences during this period, the subscription is automatically terminated. User will be notified by email of the time remaining in the trial and/or grace period 5, 3 and 1 day(s) prior to the expiry of this period. Contractor may terminate this Agreement in writing with immediate effect in the following cases: a. upon an application for suspension of payments by the other party; b. in case of non-compliance with the payment obligation; c. upon grant of suspension of payment to the other party; d. in case of an application for bankruptcy by the other party; e. upon declaration of bankruptcy of the other party; f. in case of administration, guardianship or debt restructuring of the other party. User may, within 24 hours of termination of this Agreement, download the data that has been collected, processed and stored with the Software, and store the data under its own management. After expiry of this period, User will no longer have access to the data. Obligations Contractor During the term of this Agreement, Contractor and User will enter into a service level agreement (SLA). In this, the parties agree on the support that Contractor will provide when the Software is used (the 'Service Level Agreement'). In addition, the SLA contains the availability of the service and the monitoring functions associated with the SLA. Under the terms of the Service Level Agreement, the Parties agree as follows: Contractor provides support times on working days from 09:00h to 17:00h from Monday to Friday excluding official holidays in the Netherlands. (New Year's Day, Good Friday, Easter Sunday and Monday, King's Day, Liberation Day, Ascension Day, Whitsun, Christmas). Support requests are processed and answered within 24 hours during business days. If there is no resolution to the request, a case will be created for further investigation. Contractor provides first- and second-line technical support to User via email, via the support portal (https://support.supplychain365.com) and the support request form. Support is provided on the basis of a ticket system. If User works with the Software through a Microsoft Partner, this support is provided by the Partner. Contractor further provides a product manual explaining the functions and use of the software. Likewise, Contractor provides video manuals (tutorials) demonstrating specific functions. Contractor shall provide an FAQ - frequently asked questions - document in the Software manual so that User can quickly search for answers for frequently asked questions about the Software. Updates are continuously delivered by Contractor to User. Updates come in various forms: Via the Microsoft AppSource portal (for the extension) and the Business Central Admin Centre. Updates to the SupplyChain365 Back-end are delivered in the maintenance window on Wednesdays UTC time 19:00h - 19:15h. During this maintenance window, service may be temporarily interrupted. (166/168 hours per week) based on the combined SLAs of all parties involved. Contractor can never be liable to the user for system failure or other downtime or unavailability of the service, due to actions on the part of Microsoft. User is responsible for the data collection and ensures that this is done in accordance with applicable laws and regulations (such as the General Data Protection Regulation). articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/c.summary:
How to create a new company | SupplyChain365

    How to create a new company What is a company? Think of a company as a container that holds information about a legal entity. How to add a new company to Business Central: A new company can be added in the company list page. You can reach this page by clicking the search button or pressing Alt + Q and typing 'companies' in the search bar. From the search results, select â€˜Companiesâ€™. In the company list page, we are going to make a new company. Click â€˜Newâ€™, and then â€˜Create new companyâ€™. Click Next, and then enter the company name. Note: To create a new company, you must be assigned the SUPER permission set. Click Next and choose Production - Setup Data Only. Click Next, and then click Finish. Note: when you create a new company, it takes a few minutes before you can access it in Business Central. The Setup Status on the company page indicates whether the new company is ready yet. If so, you can switch to the new company in My Settings menu. Go to the gear icon menu and select My Settings and then Company. Choose the Skynet Corporation and click OK, and then OK again. You are now in the Skynet Corporation company, and it is ready for use. Note: once a company is created, you can't change its name, but you can change its display name. articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/c.title: How to create a sandbox environment | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/c.summary:
How to create a sandbox environment | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    How to create a sandbox environment What's an environment? Companies in Business Central online exist in what are referred to as environments. There are two types of environments: Production and Sandbox. In short, production environments contain live business data, and sandbox environments are used as a safe place to test things like new business processes or features. If you have access to a company, you have access to the environment it's in. If you have access to more than one company, and those companies are in different environments, when you sign in to Business Central you must specify the environment that you want to work in. Environments are particular to a given area, so if your organization works in multiple countries or regions, you need separate environments for each one. If you have access to a company, you have access to the environment it's in. How to create a sandbox environment Make sure your account has the 'Dynamics 365 Administrator' role set for your tenant. Follow the next steps: Go to Microsoft 365 Administration Center > Users and check your usersâ€™ role assignments. Go to your Microsoft Edge browser, and login to the Dynamics 365 Business Central admin center. In Business Central you can find the admin center under the gear icon button (âš™ï¸). In the Admin center, go to Environments and review the list of your current Business Central environments. Create a new Environment by clicking on the + in the menu. Name your new environment (e.g. SupplyChain365-demo-test), select 'Sandbox' as the type, choose your country and choose the latest version of Business Central. When finished, click 'Create'. It will take a couple of minutes for your new Environment to be created. Go to the company in your newly created Sandbox by clicking the URL: https://businesscentral.dynamics.com/ / In a new Sandbox, you get 2 companies by default. CRONUS (Microsoft's demo company) and an empty My Company. Databases are protected by automatic backups that are kept for 28 days. The backup includes data from any production and sandbox environments in the database. Below a video to understand the steps visually:

    How to load SupplyChain365 demonstration data How to load Supply Chain 365 demonstration data We have created a new company by the name of Skynet. As you see there is no data available, so to work with data, we must load demo data. Let's start! Loading the Skynet demo data: Go to the Microsoft Edge browser, and login to Business Central. Switch to the Supply Chain 365 Profile Role Center by using the gear icon and My Settings. Select the Supply Chain 365 Profile from the Role list and click OK. From the Role Center main menu, go to Setup and select Demo Data. A new screen will appear. Click the Skynet Demo Data button. The system will ask you whether you are sure you want to insert demo data. Click yes and again yes for confirmation. It will take a couple of minutes to load all the demo data into the current company. When done, close the screen and refresh the Business Central cues to review the changes. Well done! Our demo data was loaded successfully. Now, we can use the demo data. Enjoy! below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/g.title: Getting started with SupplyChain365 | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/g.summary:
Getting started with SupplyChain365 | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    Getting started with SupplyChain365 To get started quickly and learn to Operate SupplyChain365, we have created a feature in the SupplyChain365 Extension called "demo-data". Starting from an empty company, this feature will fill Business Central with the information needed to demonstrate & test most of the capabilities and features of SupplyChain365, For the demo-data we use an imaginary company called SkyNet. From the movie picture Terminator featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger. SkyNet is a manufacturer and whole seller of Drones. The demo-data contains customers, vendors, items, orders, locations, employees etc. But more importantly, the demo data is completely configured so that all the features and capabilities are ready to go. This way you do not have to spend time configuring the system before you can use the APP to proces a picking order with a mobile device for example. With every update of the Extension the demo-data will be updated as well to demo and test specific scenarios or new features that have been added. We recommend using a Sandbox Environment with a blank (production setup data only) Company, when you want to get started and learn SupplyChain365 . Installing the SupplyChain365 Extension into a company in a Sandbox environment will not influence any production systems or databases. TABLE OF CONTENTS Getting started Checklist Watch Getting started with SupplyChain365 video Getting started Checklist Before you get started make sure you have followed these steps first: Registered your tenant at: the SupplyChain365 Registration Portal Login to the SupplyChain365 portal at: https://portal.supplychain365.net Install SupplyChain365 Extension from AppSource into your Environment Grant consent on behalf of your organisation Check that you have licenses on the SupplyChain365 Portal > Admin > Licenses Either you have trail licenses from your trail period You have purchased licenses on the portal Link Business Central Environments to SupplyChain365 Portal If you have not completed these steps, please go to How to register for SupplyChain365 and follow these steps before you can get started.     How to get the SupplyChain365 extension Installing the SupplyChain365 extension: Go to the Microsoft Edge browser. Login to Business Central. In Business Central click on the search icon or press Alt+Q and type: 'extension marketplace'. The AppSource page will be opened with a list of all available apps for Business Central. Alternatively, you can go to the AppSource website and install the Extension from there. In the search bar enter: 'SupplyChain365' and press enter. In the search results the SupplyChain365 App will be displayed. By clicking the 'Free trial' button a confirmation window will be displayed. Click the 'Free trial' button again to install the SupplyChain365 Extension. SupplyChain365 has now been installed and is available for all companies within the environment. articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/i.summary:
Installing the SupplyChain365 mobile app | SupplyChain365

    Installing the SupplyChain365 mobile app Mobile device and application This article cover the following issues: Adding mobile devices deleting mobile devices editing mobile device connecting mobile device and copying installer file to mobile device. If you want to install the mobile application on your Android device go to the admin menu and select Downloads. Then select the APK file SupplyChain365, which is an installer file for Android system. Step-by-step application installation Go to portal.supplychain365.net Click on supplychain365 application (APK) Connect your mobile device to laptop via USB cable and transfer the application Click on the application (APK) and install Open the SupplyChain365 application Downloading the SupplyChain365 mobile application: If you want to install the application on your Android phone, go to admin menu and select Downloads. Then select SupplyChain365-App (APK file), which is an installer file for Android. It will appear in your downloads folder. Next step is to move it to your Android device: First, connect your mobile device and turn on USB debugging mode. Then, copy the SupplyChain365 APK file to your mobile device and select the application to start the installation process. Now, open the application on your mobile device and wait until the screen is loaded. Once you see the screen, use the scan button on your device to scan the QR-code. In a few seconds, the login screen appears . Then, login with your credentials. When a new device is added successfully, you can see information about the device, like its name, brand and model. In the SupplyChain365 portal you can edit and delete the devices that have been connected. Mobile users can download the application from the Supplychain365 Portal or in the Play Store. articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/l.title: How to add label printer layouts to SupplyChain365 | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/l.summary:
How to add label printer layouts to SupplyChain365 | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    How to add label printer layouts to SupplyChain365 What is a label? The most important functions of labels are to describe the product, its usage, cautions in use, and specify its contents. Identification of the product or brand are other important functions performed by labels. In the video below we will show you how to add, edit and delete labels. To create your own labels you need to take the next steps: To add labels click on the component menu, select labels and then click on the new button to create a label. Select a name for the label, for example: Receipt Header or Receipt line. In SupplyChain365 we have various processes like: inventory count header, inventory count line, item, license plate header, receipt header, receipt line. All of these processes have their own properties. In the receipt header process, we have many properties: Number, Location Code, Bin Code, Posting Date, and more. In the receipt line process, we have the following item properties. Source document, source number, item number, description and more. These are the item properties that can be seen on the label and that can be printed. ZPL Code (Zebra Programming Language) ZPL is the language used by all ZPL compatible printers. It is a command based language that is used by the printers as instructions to create the images on the labels. Here I have the codes for the Receipt header process and the Receipt line process. To add the code, you have to make sure it is active. If it is not active, then the label will not be printed. You can make more than one label per process. When itâ€™s finished, in the preview you can see all the information on the label which comes from different processes. Save the label so you can print it later. Note: In part 2 of the video, we will see that it is possible to create a label just by using Zebra Designer software, without any knowledge of coding. It is so easy. Just try it. We are going to create a label for the receipt header process and one for the receipt line process. How to edit and delete labels. Letâ€™s look at a label. Here we can edit a label, for example the receipt header label Click edit and change â€˜Posting Dateâ€™ to â€˜Assign Dateâ€™. Preview it and see how it has changed. When you're finished, save the current changes. You can simply delete a label by clicking the delete button. The item will be deleted permanently. How to create a label with the help of software (without coding). This is in part 2 of the videos below. We use Zebra Designer to create labels and edit labels. Here are the steps: Go to www.zebra.com and select Support and Downloads, then Printer and click on Software Support. Here you find everything available for printers, such as designing barcode labels or cards, drivers, developer tools, device management and security. Here we select designing barcode labels and from the drop down menu go down and click on Zebra Designer. There is a lot of information about the Zebra Designer software. If you want to use this software with extra features, you must download the latest Zebra Designer with license. For now, we use the free version of Zebra Designer. Scroll down till you find the zebra designer installer file with .exe extension. Download and install it. The steps to install are so easy. Just follow the on-screen instructions. Create Label for Receipt Header process and Receipt Line process. In this last video below we will show you how to make a label for the Receipt Header process and a label for the Receipt line process. The steps are really simple. Just follow the on-screen instructions. In the video below we are using Zebra Designer. It's very easy and efficient. Note: Anyone without knowledge of Z P L coding can use this software. This area is called the header, the Receipt header. We will first make a label for this process. This area is called the line, the receipt line. We will also make a label for this process. Let's start the Zebra software and see how labels are made. Part1: Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/gettingstarted/gettingstarted/l.summary:
How to add label printers to SupplyChain365 | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    How to add label printers to SupplyChain365 This article is about adding label printers to the Supplychain365 Portal A label printer is a computerized device that prints on self-adhesive label sheets and label material. It is typically designed to be connected to a computer that has the necessary software to make up the label prints. Label printers are used in a wide range of applications, including logistics, retail, healthcare and warehousing. How to add a printer to the SupplyChain365 Portal: Click on components. Then click on printers to add a new printer. Here we have no printer at all. Let's click new and fill in the form: name, IP Address, port number, brand, model, description, and, if necessary, serial number. Then click save. A new printer has been added to the SupplyChain365 Portal and is ready to be used. Here you see a list of all the printers with complete information about the device, like name, IP address, port number, and brand. If you want to add a new printer, just click the new button with the plus icon. Here you can edit a printer's details, e.g. if you want to change the IP address or assign a new port number. In order to delete a printer, simply click delete. It is important that your device can connect the printer by IP and port directly in the network infrastructure. below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

    How to link Environment to SupplyChain365 How to link your environment to SupplyChain365 Now the SupplyChain365 extension is installed. You can also install supplychain365 extension from Microsoft app source website. The next step is to link SupplyChain365 to your Business Central environment. In your Microsoft Edge browser, open a new tab and go to https://portal.supplychain365.net/. Login with your Microsoft work account. Only a user with admin rights can link environments. Go to the admin menu > Users and grant permission on behalf of your organization. You only have to do this once in the Users page. Karel can import the office users of the organization. As you can see, Karel is an admin user. Now go to the admin menu. Select environment and click Register environment. A link code will be generated. Next, click â€˜Copy to clipboardâ€™. Go to the business Central window and open the SupplyChain365 Role Center. In the Supply Chain 365 Role center, go to setup in the main menu and click Link Portal. First go to https://portal.supplychain365.net. Then click log in to enter the main page of the SupplyChain365 Portal. Note: the SupplyChain365 Portal works with your companyâ€™s registered email address. Here we see a number of different menus. Letâ€™s look at them one by one. On the right side, there is the SupplyChain365 logo. By clicking it you see the current user and the sign out button. Next to the SupplyChain365 logo, you see the language menu where you can choose between different languages. With the buttons on the left side, you can navigate to all the important pages, such as the home page that displays which organization is currently using the SupplyChain365 Portal. The components menu consists of different options like labels, printers, devices and more. The admin menu consists of administration and management options regarding different aspects of the SupplyChain365 Portal. SupplyChain365 provides licenses for the various modules: Warehouse, Transport & Delivery, Collaborate & Exchange, Third Party Logistics and Value Added Logistics and Scheduler. For example, we want to buy a warehouse server license and warehouse device licenses for 5 workers. Simply click on admin, then licenses and select warehouse. articles/gettingstarted/modules/3plandva.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: 3PL & Value added logistics | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/modules/3plandva.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: 3PL & Value added logistics | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: 3PL & Value added logistics TABLE OF CONTENTS 3PL customer definition 3PL items 3PL Inbound orders 3PL Outbound orders 3PL integration WMS and TMS Inventory management for third parties 3PL & VAL activities 3PL invoice 3PL VAL reports 3PL customer definition Create 3PL customers and record all customer data. Use the integrated CRM system for 3PL customers. 3PL items Create items for a specific 3PL customer so a 3PL partner can store items in the warehouse. 3PL Inbound orders Register incoming inventory from 3PL customers using 3PL inbound orders. 3PL Outbound orders Register 3PL result orders to store stock on behalf of the 3PL customer to the right client. 3PL integration WMS and TMS Use the integrated modules of Warehouse & Transport to perform 3PL activities and register them in the system. Inventory management for third parties Keep track of which stock and items of which 3PL are customers. Use the integrated WMS third-party inventory management system. 3PL & VAL activities Automatically register all warehouse and transport activities per 3PL customer and link rates with scales to this. 3PL invoice Automatically generate invoices for warehouse and transport activities carried out for 3PL customers. Adjust the invoice for sending and booking. 3PL VAL reports Reporting to a comprehensive specification from a certain period of time to show all 3PL VAL activities.

articles/gettingstarted/modules/collabor.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Collaborate & Exchange | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/modules/collabor.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Collaborate & Exchange | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Collaborate & Exchange TABLE OF CONTENTS Partner portal login Company details Documents customer Documents vendor Documents 3PL customer Stock information EDI Wizard profile EDI Wizard template Partner portal login Via the portal it is possible to invite partners to provide insight into the administration. For example, a supplier can view purchase orders and warehouse receipts. A customer can view the sales orders and warehouse shipments. Finally, a 3PL client can view the 3PL incoming and outgoing orders, warehouse receipts and shipments and an up-to-date insight into warehouse stock per location. Company details Through the company details you can view the details of the company and its contacts. Documents customer A customer can view the sales orders and warehouse shipments. Views can be saved and exported to Excel. Documents vendor A supplier can view purchase orders and warehouse receipts. Views can be saved and exported to Excel. Documents 3PL customer A 3PL client can view the 3PL incoming and outgoing orders, warehouse receipts and shipments and an up-to-date insight into warehouse stock. Stock information A 3PL client can view de actual stock in the warehouse, the different locations that are available and the license plates that are used. Views are made and saved by the client and exports are possible to Excel. EDI Wizard profile Within the wizard profile the partner can choose the way how files are exchanged (by services like OneDrive and Storage Accounts). EDI Wizard template Within the template wizard it is possible to map the fields from EDI to business central fields of the documents that are used in the process.

articles/gettingstarted/modules/moduleso.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Modules overview | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/modules/moduleso.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Modules overview | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Modules overview Supplychain365 consists of modules. Modules are activated by enabling them under: Admin > Licenses in the SupplyChain365 portal. Each module contains specific functionalities that are important for the relevant processes. Short summary of features of each module: Warehouse Transform your warehouse operation and eliminate paper processes. Optimize inbound, storage and outbound of goods using barcode scanning or RFID. Use integrated wireless mobile technology to collaborate in real-time between the back office and the logistics shop fl oor. Use workfl ows to automate routine tasks. Use the automated inventory to quickly count inventory with a mobile barcode scanner. Register serial numbers, lot numbers and print barcode labels. Process pallet deliveries using license plates as logistic unit. Transport Digital transformation of the transport process, delivery and collection of goods. Easily convert orders to transport orders. Assign drivers and trucks or cars and plan trips automatically or manually. Show the progress of a trip and the position of the load/driver/truck on a map in real time. Collect signatures and data from every job and trip in real time. Record the start and end time of each order and consignment. Set up a question path to collect additional data about each transport activity. Schedule vehicle docking time and use the integrated warehouse vehicle pick and load capabilities to make the transportation process work in tandem with warehouse operation. Collaborate & Exchange This module is especially for transport and storage companies that perform logistics for third parties. 3PL. Register inbound, storage and outbound per client. Easily report real-time stock positions per client and keep track of which stock, fhas been where, for how long. Make use of effi cient cross docking and minimize waiting times for loading and unloading trucks. Set which rates are used for charging to the customer per client and per activity. Automatic reporting of custody fees per 3PL customer. Works seamlessly with the Warehouse, Transport and Collaborate & Exchange modules for flawless execution of 3PL processes. 3PL & VAL This module is especially for transport and storage companies that perform logistics for third parties. 3PL. Register inbound, storage and outbound per client. Easily report real-time stock positions per client and keep track of which stock, has been where, for how long. Make use of efficient cross docking and minimize waiting times for loading and unloading trucks. Set which rates are used for charging to the customer per client and per activity. Automatic reporting of custody fees per 3PL customer. Works seamlessly with the Warehouse, Transport and Collaborate & Exchange modules for flawless execution of 3PL processes.

articles/gettingstarted/modules/transpor.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Transport execution | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/modules/transpor.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Transport execution | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Transport execution TABLE OF CONTENTS Auto definitions Transport drivers & Resources Consignments Tripplanner Sequence planner Geocodering Trip information on map Auto trip planning Integration WMS Dock planning OTM (Open Trip Model) Real-time map and vehicle data Emission calculation Toll road Loads/Consignments Transport Rates Automatic transport costs calculation Invoice SupplyChain365 TMS workflows Questionary paths Driver APP Reports Automatic trip planning Auto definitions Capture car data in the system and schedule it as a resource. Specify type, load volume, load weight, EuroNorm, number of axles etc. Transport drivers & Resources Assign transport employees (drivers and co-drivers) to resources so that time tracking, resource planning and resource costs become transparent for all transport activities. Consignments A transport consignment with a linked actions to pick up or bring goods (loading/unloading) Tripplanner Trips are the entities that are actually planned and assigned to cars and transport employees. Sequence planner Let the system calculate the best order for executing multiple transport orders. Geocodering Automatically obtain geo location codes of addresses when creating transport orders and trips. Record geolocations for addresses in the reuse system. Trip information on map View the calculated ride and sequence on a map and make any adjustments to optimize a ride. Auto trip planning Based on the transport orders and available cars and drivers, create an automated planning and sequence and adjust it manually if necessary. Integration WMS Let TMS and WMS work together in an integrated way by planning warehouse operations based on transport orders and trips. Dock planning Use trip dock planning and warehouse jobs to prepare inventory for the right dock. OTM (Open Trip Model) Use the Collaborate & Exchange module to work with OTM-based customers and suppliers to obtain transport orders and provide feedback on status. Real-time map and vehicle data Use the SupplyChain365 vehicle IoT module for real-time vehicle data and show the current position of vehicles on a map. Emission calculation Make automatic emission calculations per transport order and trip. Toll road Automatically generate and calculate toll roads data per transport order and trip. Loads/Consignments A consignment is stock with a destination and has certain dimensions and weight. Transport Rates Rates based on mileage, weight, volume and a combination thereof including graduated calculations. Automatic transport costs calculation Let the system automatically perform transport cost calculations per transport order, trip and client. Invoice Generate transport costs invoices for clients based on all transport activities. SupplyChain365 TMS workflows Automate transport transactions and automatically create documents and transport activities by arranging a workflow and providing parameters. Questionary paths Make question paths in multiple languages that must be handled by the driver in the SupplyChain365 TMS APP. Use fields such as text, selection sequence (multi) selection dropdown (single), photo, GPS data, date/time, scan barcode and capture signature. Driver APP Use the SupplyChain365 TMS drivers APP for time registrations of trips and transport orders and recording transport activities. The driver can show all trips in the future that are planned. Reports It is possible to print reports of the consignments and trips before and after. In this way, the process can also be carried on paper. Of course, the advice is to use the driver app. Automatic trip planning It is possible to automatically schedule all consignments on trips via Supplychain365by means of the PTV trip planning that is available as standard in the solution. Additional transactions are charged for this.

articles/gettingstarted/modules/warehous.title: SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Warehouse execution | SupplyChain365
articles/gettingstarted/modules/warehous.summary:
SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Warehouse execution | SupplyChain365
Search Results for

    SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Warehouse execution TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction to Warehouse execution Mobile App Mobile App WMS settings Serialnumbers / Lotnumbers SupplyChain365 WMS workflows Break-bulk Create License Plates Change location Receive Put-Away Order picking Zone / Batch / Tote picking Movements / Replenishment Ad hoc movements Shipments Loading/unloading Inventory/Counting Bin content Article availability Adjust units of measurement Kitting â€“ make/break Licenseplate Printing labels Connect Bluetooth scanning devices Block Items, Serialnumber & Lotnumbers Introduction to Warehouse execution The SupplyChain365 Warehouse and Logistics solution consists of the Extension and the mobile application. Mobile App Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform warehouse activities. Mobile App WMS settings Set parameters for each warehouse activity and automate the logistics flow per warehouse location. Serialnumbers / Lotnumbers Register serial and lot numbers using barcode scanning or RFID on the mobile device with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. SupplyChain365 WMS workflows Automate warehouse transactions and automatically create documents and warehouse activities by arranging a workflow and providing parameters. Break-bulk Change the packaging unit in the logistics process (from pallets to boxes from boxes to pieces) by using the break-bulk function. Create License Plates Create license plates (logistics units: pallets/containers, etc.) and move large amounts of stock on entry, storage and removal with one barcode scan. Change location Create settings by warehouse/branch assign warehouse users and easily switch between locations. Receive Receive of goods and automatic booking of warehouse receipts including Licenseplates, serial and lot number registration. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Require receive item scan, Scan receive bin first, Batch Posting, Require scan every item, Allow over-receipt, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Use Suggested CrossDockBin in receiving, Scanning of a serial number is required, Enable license plate recording. Put-Away Storage of goods in the warehouse using barcode scanning. Register which goods are placed at which storage locations (bins). Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Always automatically create a put-away, Create a put-away when receipt complete, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a Serial number is required. Order picking Process pick jobs using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP on mobile devices with barcode scanners. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required, Breakbulk flow required. Zone / Batch / Tote picking Collect multiple orders in one run and place items directly in shipping boxes or crates with one or more boxes/crates per order. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Movements / Replenishment Move inventory in the warehouse, process replenishment tasks with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required Ad hoc movements Register ad hoc movements with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP and process them automatically. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Shipments Book warehouse shipments and print labels and packing slips with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Loading/unloading Use loading lists when WMS works with TMS for loading and unloading shipments. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Inventory/Counting Create periodic inventory counting lists and check the stock status using the barcode scanning and the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Bin content Check the contents of a storage location (bin) using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Article availability Search for items at warehouse storage locations by scanning item number or barcode with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Adjust units of measurement Add units of measure to items or adjust units of measure. For example: length, width, height, weaving, packaging. Kitting â€“ make/break Licenseplate Use the mobile app to pack items together from a single order or to repack items in new packaging. The consumption of packaging material and a new license plate can be activated. Printing labels Print barcode/RFID labels in any warehouse process of items, orders, order lines, serial numbers, lot numbers and license plates. Connect Bluetooth scanning devices Use external Bluetooth scanners and connect them to the SupplyChain365 APP on the mobile device. Block Items, Serialnumber & Lotnumbers Items, Serialnumbers and Lotnumbers may be blocked for further logistics handling (picking, shipping, receiving etc.)
